validations.message: Only bold, italic, underline, and code marks are allowed
Only heading 1, heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, table, link to Url, and asset nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: ðŸ’Ž component - Rich image
contentTypes.description: To describe an image used in rich text fields

settings.helpText: This field is only for internal use, and lets us easily recognise an entry
Sets the meta title of the page.
Sets the page meta description.
Consolidates duplicate URLs.
When set to "true", disallows search engines from crawling the links on this page.
When set to "true", disallows search engines from indexing this page.
Images that will be used in share previews on social media and in search results.
This field is only for internal use, and lets us easily recognise an entry
The name of the author
An avatar used for the author
This field is only for internal use, and lets us easily recognise an entry
These are the SEO fields used for this specific page
The slug is the part of the URL on which page will be available on https://yourwebsite.com/your-slug-goes-here
The author of the blog article
Date when the blog post was published
The title of the blog post
The subtitle of the blog post
This image appears at the top of the blog post page and is also included in tiles that link to the blog post
This rich text field makes up text of the blog post
This field is only for internal use, and lets us easily recognise an entry
Caption shown beneath the image
This checkbox determines if the image should be the full width of the page, as opposed to fitting in the rich text block it was used in.
